TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit Missing extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Represents a missing . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Missing class is used to invoke a method with a default argument, typically when using reflection.
Only one instance of Missing, which is returned by the <xref:System.Reflection.Missing.Value> field, ever exists.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Missing object to invoke a method with a default argument by using reflection.
[!code-cs[System.Reflection.Missing#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.reflection.miss_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Reflection.Missing#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.reflection.miss_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable.GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to be populated with serialization information.
The object representing the destination context of the serialization.
Docs.summary: Sets a object with the logical context information needed to recreate the sole instance of the object.
Docs.permission: Requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Reflection.Missing Value

Docs.summary: Represents the sole instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this instance of the <xref:System.Reflection.Missing> class to represent missing values, for example, when you invoke methods that have default parameter values. For a code example, see the <xref:System.Reflection.Missing> class.
